description: A basic Android native Kotlin application template using Salesforce Mobile SDK. This template provides a foundation for building Android apps that integrate with Salesforce, featuring basic authentication, REST API integration, and a simple list-based interface.
useCase: Use this template when you need to create a basic Android native app that integrates with Salesforce using Kotlin. It's ideal for developers starting with Salesforce Mobile SDK who want a minimal but functional starting point with REST API capabilities.

customizationPoints.description: Customize the app name, package name, and build configuration
instructions: Update template.js with new app name and package name
Modify package.json with new app name
Update build.gradle.kts with new package name
Update settings.gradle.kts with new app name
Update strings.xml with new app name

customizationPoints.description: Add custom Salesforce object queries and REST API calls
instructions: Modify MainActivity.kt to add custom REST API calls
Add new SObject queries in MainActivity
Update MainApplication.kt for custom SDK configuration
Implement custom data models for new SObjects

customizationPoints.description: Customize the authentication and login experience
instructions: Configure QR code login in MainApplication.kt
Customize QrCodeEnabledLoginActivity for specific login flows
Enable IDP login flow if needed
Configure push notification handling

customizationPoints.description: Extend the user interface with additional components
instructions: Add new UI components to MainActivity.kt
Create new layout files for additional screens
Implement navigation between activities
Add custom themes and styling

customizationPoints.description: Customize the build and dependency configuration
instructions: Add new dependencies in app/build.gradle.kts
Configure build variants and signing
Update SDK versions and compatibility
Add custom build tasks if needed
